metadata.description: Registry of all data sources used in MedAdmit predictions

sources.description: GPA and MCAT score grid showing applicants and acceptees for U.S. MD-granting medical schools. Aggregated data from 2021-2024 application cycles.
sources.citation: Association of American Medical Colleges. Table A-23: MCAT and GPA Grid for Applicants and Acceptees to U.S. MD-Granting Medical Schools, 2021-2022 through 2023-2024 (Aggregated). AAMC, 2024.

sources.description: MCAT scores and GPAs for applicants and matriculants by race/ethnicity for the 2023-2024 application cycle.
sources.citation: Association of American Medical Colleges. Table A-18: MCAT Scores and GPAs for Applicants and Matriculants to U.S. MD-Granting Medical Schools by Race/Ethnicity. AAMC, 2024.

sources.description: Medical School Admission Requirements database with individual school statistics including GPA/MCAT medians, acceptance rates, and demographics.
sources.citation: AAMC Medical School Admission Requirements (MSAR) Database, 2024-2025 Edition.

sources.description: Peer-reviewed study analyzing URM acceptance rates controlling for GPA and MCAT. Found URM OR = 5.42 (95% CI: 4.89-6.01) compared to non-URM applicants with same credentials.
sources.citation: Ko MJ, et al. Trends in medical school admissions by race/ethnicity following the COVID-19 pandemic. BMC Med Educ. 2023;23:392.

sources.description: Historical AAMC data showing acceptance rates by race/ethnicity at each GPA/MCAT combination. AAMC stopped publishing this cross-tabulated format after 2016.
sources.citation: Association of American Medical Colleges. Applicants and Matriculants Data by Race/Ethnicity, GPA, and MCAT, 2013-2016 (Historical).
sources.notes: Used to derive odds ratio estimates when combined with more recent aggregate data. Note data is 8+ years old.

sources.sourceName: U.S. News Best Medical Schools Rankings
sources.description: U.S. News & World Report rankings for medical schools in research and primary care categories.
sources.citation: U.S. News & World Report. Best Medical Schools Rankings 2024.

adjustmentFactors.notes: Controlling for GPA and MCAT. Represents aggregate URM advantage.
Estimated from holistic review literature. Effect varies by school mission.
Estimated from holistic review literature. Schools vary in weight given.
Significant advantage at schools with rural medicine missions. Less impact at urban research schools.
Effect strongest at research-focused institutions. Publications add additional boost.
Baseline expectation. Less than 200 hours is a red flag at most schools.
Average advantage. Some schools (TX, WA) have OR > 5. Private schools have OR close to 1.
